meanings.definition: To put in a position before or ahead of others.
meanings.sent1: She preplaces her books neatly on the shelf before leaving the room.
meanings.sent2: The teacher always preplaces the important information at the beginning of the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel preplaces its acorns in a secret hiding spot for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work preplaces him as a leader among his peers.
meanings.sent5: The early bird preplaces its nest with soft feathers for its eggs.

meanings.definition: To put in a position or rank before others.
meanings.sent1: The talented musician preplaces all others in the competition with her outstanding performance.
meanings.sent2: The experienced employee always preplaces his colleagues for promotion with his hard work.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat preplaces itself on the highest shelf to watch the room from above.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity preplaces her as the most beloved member of the community.
meanings.sent5: The bright star preplaces all others in the night sky with its shimmering light.

meanings.definition: To put in a position or rank before others.
meanings.sent1: The diligent student preplaces her assignments on the teacher's desk before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The skilled chef preplaces his signature dish on the menu before introducing new items.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy preplaces its favorite toy in front of the door to greet its owner.
meanings.sent4: His determination and perseverance preplaces him as a top contender in the upcoming race.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flower preplaces all others in the garden with its vibrant petals.
